Description: Fragment of thick red wool, weft-faced plain weave cloth with part of a tapestry band in yellow and dark blue; decoration in a band of an undulating vine stem with leaves and tendrils (original width of band c.2.8cm); plain weave: warp-red wool (S/c.9), weft-red wool (S/c.42-45); tapestry on single threads: warp-red wool (S/c.9), weft-yellow and dark blue wool (S/c.42-45); all edges cut or ragged; almost certainly from a tunic, the stripe from either a shoulder or sleeve
Curator's comments: Unreg. 40; design relates to finds from Kharga Oasis in MMA, New York, dated around first half of 4th C.
